results.title: Solomon Island treasures
results.creator_credit: Ian Walker, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Depicts Solomon Islands men and women displaying traditional skills and techniques. Provides an insight into the lifestyle of the people and the myths and legends interpreted in their art.

results.title: Solo
results.creator_credit: Mike Hoover, David Adams and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Mike Hoover as the climber portrays the efforts and exhilarations that are experienced by the solo mountain climber. Filmed in Mexico, the United States and Canada on 21 different climbs this story explores the pleasures and dangers of mountain climbing by presenting three aspects of climbing of which the non-climber is rarely aware. These are the driving rhythm of sustained physical effort, the discovery of scenes and weathers unknown to others and the commitment to challenges which must be met alone.

results.title: Solids, liquids and gases: Newton's laws of motion (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Millington, Barrie Whatley, British Broadcasting Corporation and Open University
results.brief_description: Experimental evidence for Newton’s laws of motion is examined and a number of experiments are demonstrated to show the effect of forces on a massive concrete sphere. Illustrates concepts like kinetic and potential energy, compressional energy and the behaviour of matter in a force free environment
results.title_for_label: Solids, liquids and gases: Newton’s laws of motion (TEFC)

results.title: Soldiers in Sinai: a peacekeeping story
results.creator_credit: Pierre des Bonnet and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: A basic film on the setting up of a UN Emergency Force - men flown to the Sinai Desert on short notice to take up positions between two opposing lines, for the peace keeping operation that followed in the wake of 1973 war in the Middle East. Shows how troops from many nations learn to work together as a unique international peace force.

results.title: Soldering
results.brief_description: Indicates that soldering plays a vital part in modern electronics and that it is esential to understand the art of soldering if becoming involved in this field. Provides the theory and demostrates the practical processes. No other credits available

results.title: Soldered spigot joint
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plumbing”.
Tapering the end of the pipe with special tool, opening out with mandrel, use of coning tool for shaping, insertion of brass liner and application of solder. Recapitulation in diagram form.

results.title: Solder
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plumbing”.
Making a roof cesspool by another method, use of solder. Consideration of materials used. The solder itself, wiping cloths, plumbers’ black. Preparing the work for soldering; method of soldering; tools used.

results.title: Solar promise
results.creator_credit: Tom Putnam, Henry Mayer and Bullfrog Films
results.brief_description: Examines the use of solare energy for home heating. Active and passive systems are illustrated and the principles of each are outlined. A variety of homes are shown and the costs, advantages and potential for a wide range of climate conditions are fully covered. Reference is made to the indians of southwest America who understood and used passive solar heating.

results.title: Solar power
results.creator_credit: Leo A. Handel, Peter Mertens and Handel Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Discusses a large number of examples of solar power. Presents three specific areas of energy generation and preservation: passive solar heating, active thermal heating and photovoltaic production of electricity.
